186029053.review:
--Opening Statement--

OK! Fallout 4... where do I begin... well, first off... I enjoy the game play, crafting, and base building... that's about it though. To me, at least, I tend to just put off doing the story for as long as humanly possible, because the main story, with all the factions is just... so f--king bad man... like, this is, easily, the worst written fallout game, since it's pretty much a rehash of Fallout 3's story, and it goes no further than that. Sure, you get the chance to join the bad guys in this one but... that's not that big of a difference, and the Enclave wasn't mentioned anywhere meaningful until AFTER the Next Gen update.

So... I love the crafting, I like the base building, and I like the game play (And how you can finally sprint).

-- My biggest problems are...

The Story (See Above)
The Factions (See Below)
The weapon redesigns. (Prime example the Assault Rifle. Thing looks like a blimp.)
And the new power armor. (I literally never use it anymore, I just collect it for collections sake. Also, you can't use unarmed weapons in it any more, unlike in 3 and NV. See more below)

--FACTIONS--

The factions of the game that you can join are...

-The Minutemen: They are the first you meet if you follow the story. You are made the leader... pretty much instantly, and are majority radiant quests for settlements. To me, they are the most bearable faction, do to them being so... white board-like. They are the fallback faction, you cannot become hostile to them, and they are the only faction you cannot exterminate... but over all, they are still, easily a "Good Aligned" faction. They have no reason to hate The Institute... you destroy them anyway, as you have no choice.

-The Brotherhood Of Steel (BoS): After Fallout 3, these guys REALLY kicked the bucket hard. They have more or less earned the name of "Enclave Lite" do to their new similarities with the Enclave. They are led by a returning character, Scribe Maxon, now known as Elder Maxon... that is the only refferrance to Fallout 3, and it's BoS Chapter. They hate Super Mutants, Synths, and The Institute, and don't want anyone else having Tech, more or less. They are a "Good Aligned" faction. You cannot lead this faction. It contradicts itself countless times.

-The Railroad: They are the only faction it is MANDATORY you interact with. They help free escaped synths from The Institute. They see synths as slaves, needing to be freed. They are Hostile to The Institute for the supposed slavery... they still decide to blow up The Institute. They contradict themselves a lot. They are a "Good Aligned" faction. You cannot lead this faction.

-The Institute: They are the Villains of the story. They are the poorest written of the bunch. They are the ONLY "Evil Aligned" faction you can join. They are just lousy with contradictions, in literally everything. You quickly become the leader of this faction. They are cartoonishly evil. They are a supposably hidden faction... but literally everyone knows of their existence, and views them as an enemy. They make Synthetic Humans (Synths) and replace people for... some reason, probably to collect data or something. Their tagline is "Mankind, Redefined." hence why they made the Synthetic Humans... YET THEY VIEW THEM AS NO MORE THAN MACHINES, DESPITE GIVING THEM FULL PERSONALITIES, CONSCIOUSNESS, AND AUTONOMY!

--The Power Armor--

Back in Fallout 1, 2, 3, and New Vegas, Power Armor was treated as any other clothing was. in 1 and 2, you didn't need anything to equip it. In Fallout 3 and New Vegas, you needed a perk called "Power Armor Training" to be able to wear and use Power Armor... in fallout 4, literally anyone, even raiders, can wear power armor, thanks to the new Power Armor System. It's cool, lore wise... but having it, so that anyone can use it, just doesn't make sense to me. It's a specialized, rare piece of military equipment... not everyone should be able to use it, especially not raiders... UNLESS if they were Ex-Enclave or Ex-BoS, like the Brotherhood Outcasts for instance. It doesn't help that, with the first Minuteman related quest you are given... you are practically HANDED a FULL suit of T-45 Power Armor. Sure, it's the 2nd weakest... but it's still Power Armor, and it's not that hard to repair, and you can find a PLETHORA of Fusion Cores to fuel it. It ruins the balance by a whole f--kin' lot!

--Closing Statement--

Look, I know this is a recommended review... and I know I've been sh-ttng on the game a lot... but the game play, is amazing, it's the best the fallout series has seen... but I have problems with it as well. The leveling system is super over simplified, you are given 1 perk point per level, there are no skills, their are no traits, you can't even choose your characters sexuality, as you are only ever straight (Which bothers me a tiny bit as a gay guy. Though, it's not like I really care, I never have companions or romance partners anyway). You're only ever given 4 dialogue options, and your character speaks, you are TOLD what your background is... as an RPG, this game gives you little to no freedom in choosing who your character was or is. As a male, you're an Army Veteran... as a female, you're a Lawyer.

ANYWAY, to get away from the negative... it's a good game, in terms of game play... the base building is cool, but a bit jank, and the crafting is amazing, I love the armor and weapon customization. I can only recommend it on those 3 things... so if you want something using this engine that's actually well written, I suggest playing Fallout London. It's a massive overhaul mod for FO4, it's amazing. It's to Fallout 4 what Fallout New Vegas is to Fallout 3.

Великая серия, которая закончилась на самом худшей части :(
Эта игра - сборник пустых локаций, бесконечных врагов и парочки механик крафта поселений и снаряжения. В ней нет интересного сюжета, нет каких то интересных выборов, нет классных квестов - нет души. Эта игра шагнула вперед в плане стрельбы и реализации Силовой брони (реально хорошо сделали), но эта серия никогда не славилась величайшим геймплеем (по крайне мере чисто по механикам). Всегда во главе были шикарные квесты и отыгрывание роли - тут этого от силы 2%. Есть конечно интересные напарники, большое количество прикольных локаций - вот только все что ты делаешь в них так это расстреливаешь одних и тех же болванчиков. Никакого отыгрыша тут нет (система кармы покинула чат). Даже всеми ненавистная 3 часть превосходит 4 по качеству квестов. Я молчу про то что даже финальные ролики они не потрудились сделать разными...
Для фанатов серии рекомендуется пробежать (именно пробежать) сюжетку, все остальное это мусор, на который вы потратите слишком много времени.
Спасибо Тодд что убил потенциал серии...

185981979.review:
okay, gonna keep it very simple

The game was fine before the latest update. Yes the game has always been buggy, riddled with random crashes, invalid/missing textures, so on and so forth. It was a Bethesda game and we accepted that the jank is to be expected.

This last update was not only a MASSIVE slap in the face to the Fallout Community as a whole, but to the Modding community as well. say what you will about modding as i know the gaming purists out there will shun me for even talking about modding games in general, but modding has and always will be something that changes a game up just enough to make me fall in love with it all over again.

now, what did this last update do exactly?

it added junk, clutter, debris, and other things you generally dont need and multiplied the spawn rate by a significant amount. that in itself is already a recipe for disaster because fallout veterans will note that this game in particular had a serious problem with the physics engine bugging out which led to frequent CTDs and significant performance loss. if that sounds bad to you, now think about how adding more crap in the game with the same weird physics will affect the performance of the game.

if you thought, "eh, doesnt seem like it would cause any more issues than what you already had." then congrats...you officially have shown that you have no technical understanding when it comes to game engine performance and object loading/culling. 

more objects means more collision detection, which in turn creates a heavier load on the CPU of your PC, and because the physics engine they used is pieced together with fiber and wonderglue, its going to miscalculate often, even more so with so much crap just laying around.

that's not all. the textures have supposedly undergone some kind of polishing treatment, and unfortunately there seems to be even more invalid textures trying to be loaded into the game, creating some pretty bad visual glitches. again, Fallout vets would know that this has indeed been an issue since before the update, but now the issues are getting worse and in some cases causing game breaking bugs that Bethesda wont ever patch.

But wait...what about the Modding Community i mentioned back at the beginning?

well, to put it flatly, Bethesda gave the middle finger to them. and with this update, they essentially broke their original agreement with the modding community by attempting to force paid creation club content and breaking several well known mods in the process. Bethesda gave no warning to the modding community beforehand which per the agreement they were supposed to. they caused panic throughout the modding community, and in turn Mod Devs have lost their faith in Bethesda keeping their word. right now the Modding Community is in complete disarray. not to mention its become somewhat of a wild west.

so can i recommend Fallout 4 in its current state:

no, absolutely not.
there are too many unsolved issues with the game, and said issues most likely wont be dealt with
and until it gets fixed, and they mend their relations with the modding community once more, i cannot recommend it

HOWEVER:
if you do like Fallout and you do want to try this game, then i will tell you there is a workaround that essentially reverts the last update to the game making it how it was before. what i cannot directly tell you is how to do it.

As I am sure you are aware, Fallout 4 is an action role-playing game set in a post-apocalyptic open world.

Engaging Story: Experience a captivating narrative as you search for your missing son in the Commonwealth, encountering memorable characters and factions along the way.

Immersive Gameplay: Explore a vast and detailed world filled with danger and opportunity, scavenging for resources, building settlements, and customizing your character.

Customization Options: Craft your own unique play style with a deep character progression system and extensive weapon and armor modifications. This customazation includes the use of over 3,000 player crafted mods for the game. Craft your own unique game and play style with a deep character progression system and extensive weapon and armor modification along with game rule  improvements, new locations and more.

Thrilling Combat: Engage in intense first-person or third-person combat against a variety of enemies, utilizing a wide array of weapons and abilities.

Virtual Reality Support: Immerse yourself even further with optional VR support, experiencing the wasteland like never before.

If you haven't downloaded Fallout 4 yet, you're missing out on an unforgettable post-apocalyptic adventure.

185952130.review:
I revisited Fallout 4 in late 2024 after not having touched the game since its release.  At the time of release I probably put about 20 hours in and made it to ~ act 2 of the story.  I started to get an itch to revisit the game after seeing some content on YouTube around how great Survival Mode could be (if you had the appetite for it).  So, that's the journey I embarked on.  No mods.

80ish hours later after completing the story and a bunch of side quests, I whole-heartedly recommend survival mode as the best way to experience this game.  I found it SO much more rewarding to be "forced" to interact with the settlements system, cooking, scavenging, and lack of fast-travel.  Despite what you may read online, I did not find the limitations of survival mode to be either frustrating or discouraging.  Yes, I lost some progress to crashes, though probably less than 3 times in those 80 hours, and yes, I had some tough boss fights that I could not quicksave before attempting.  I started to quickly realize that Bethesda had placed beds & sleeping bags all over the world, so saving incremental progress was never really an issue.  Finding a bed while exploring was like finding a bonfire in dark souls - very rewarding.

I found the difficulty to be very manageable as well.  Tough at the start, but once you start upgrading gear and weapons, most enemies are no match for some smart (and in my case stealthy) gameplay.  I also found myself cooking certain food and actually using chems for their buffs for tough battles.

I'm glad I took the plunge into survival mode.  It made so much of the game feel less trivial than it did on my first playthrough.  Give it a shot!

I was never big into RPGs, but always a fan of a decent FPS with the different mechanics. 

The Fallout 4 world scratches an itch I didn't know I had. Between free roaming, building weapons, building bases, unexpected funny finds (like a teddy bear with glasses sitting on a toilet "reading" a newspaper. All of which you can take back to your base.

This is my thirdish playthrough, none of which I've completed but am firm to finish this character.

Next round I might try out some mods, but the vanilla experience, with DLCs on top of the next gen upgrade make this a game I could play for years to come.

At times it can be frustrating if you are a loot hoarder, or take a clean head shot only to realize you are hitting the wall next to you are your target. 

Getting trapped in corners by legendary's while spam jumping and stimpaking to get outta of there.

Building mechanics can be heavily improved, but there are mods and tutorials for that.

for minor bugs and only 2 crashes in nearly 300 hours of gameplay.

All in all, not perfect but in my top 10 now.

185939143.review:
Fallout 4: o esgotamento criativo da Bethesda

Fallout 4 foi a última tentativa da Bethesda de recriar uma boa história e jogo no mundo pós apocalíptico mais amado pelos fãs.
Porém, é nítido que faltou inovação, criatividade e coragem por parte dos devs no desenvolvimento de um jogo que tenha os elementos de Fallout mas que traga novidades. A impressão que dá é que os desenvolvedores da Bethesda simplesmente preencheram uma lista do que o jogo precisaria ter para ser um jogo de Fallout: mundo aberto, Brotherhood of Steel, power armor e Deathclaws.

Na maior parte da main quest, que tem como ponto de partida o sequestro de seu bebê, temos que lidar com 4 facções que têm objetivos tão rasos que desafiam os limites da estupidez humana:
- Minutemen: são apenas uma mílicia que almeja defender a Commonwealth, mas dependem de você para tudo;
- Instituto: são vilões de desenho animado, em um mundo em que pessoas conseguem sobreviver por décadas confinadas nos Vaults, o Instituto, com a tecnologia mais avançada existente, incluindo TELETRANSPORTE e fabricação de Synths, não consegue ser independente da superfície;
- Railroad: são uma espécie de hippies que tem como único objetivo a proteção e "libertação" dos Synths. Irrelevante se o mundo ao redor está completamente destruído, o importante é "libertar" as máquinas, mesmo que isso represente um risco aos humanos. Aqui a Bethesda tentou elaborar uma mensagem profunda, sobre o significado de ser humano, mas pela falta de capricho a Railroad soa como um grupo de lunáticos.
- Brotherhood of Steel: aqui eu simpatizo com as dores da Bethesda, pois devido ao apego dos fãs, não é possível fazer um jogo da franquia que não conte com a presença da BoS e a justificativa para arrastá-los para a Commonwealth foi o temor do Instituto, a Bethesda parece ignorar porém, que em Fallout 2 a BoS passa praticamente toda a campanha do jogo escondida, intimidada pelo nível tecnológico da Enclave. Por qual motivo então arrumar briga com um grupo ainda mais superior? O papel da Brotherhood of Steel nessa campanha é o mais fraco da franquia até então.

O que há de divertido em Fallout? Atacar raiders e supermutantes, contruir uma base e conhecer alguns locais e personagens como Diamond City e Nick Valentine. Mas essa diversão dura poucas horas e no restante do tempo a campanha fica maçante.

Em resumo, a falta de criatividade e esforço por parte da bethesda em construir uma história cativante e deixar o caminho pronto para futuros lançamentos terminou por deixar a franquia Fallout em um limbo, sem a perspectiva de novos jogos em um futuro próximo (não, Fallout 76 não conta).

constrói robôs, e eu acho muito fodah essa dlc, porque voce pode fazer uns robôs muito aleatório e fudido, alem das missões que ela adiciona, far harbor eu não me aprofundei tanto, mas gostei muito dela pelo pouco que vi, bem interessante andar pelo mapa da ilha todo enevoado, a DLC que tu pode fazer umas maquinas industriais no game e utilizar ela pra fazer algumas coisas diferenciadas, tipo farms de itens, o fodah é que se voce joga no modo sobrevivência é muito difícil aproveita, pois você tem que ficar abastecendo com itens para gerar outros itens, e como não tem fast travel no sobrevivência, fica mais difícil ainda conseguir recursos, mas da pra resolver junto da wasteland workshop, onde ela basicamente adiciona a possibilidade de fazer arenas de luta, utilizando dela em conjunto da dlc de "industria"(n lembro o nome certo) você pode fazer farms incríveis, o jogo base vale o dinheiro que você gasta, mas não vale a penas comprar as dlc pelos valores inteiros, espere entrar em promoção pra comprar

185906822.review: This game stands as the pinnacle of human creativity—an exquisite chaos in motion. From the maddeningly glorious bugs that tear through the fabric of the experience to the surreal sight of a feral ghoul erupting in a bloody spectacle before my eyes, it’s a world that never fails to mesmerize. My companions, though often left crumpled on the ground, gasping for breath after each heated battle, excel in one thing above all: their unwavering presence. As I traverse the barren, haunting expanse of the Commonwealth, their companionship becomes a rare and precious comfort amid the madness, transforming the endless journey into something less solitary in a world that feels anything but. The enemies I encounter, with intellects as sharp as a potato, still manage to carve a special place in my heart—a space reserved only for the purest form of stupidity.

185904112.review:
Начну с того, что я огромный фанат 3-й части этой линейки, у меня дома даже 2 пупса стоят =). 
Игра в начале может показаться не интересной, из-за сценария, до войны, в вашем доме, первая мысль у меня была "что это за новая SIMS" =) Но дальше,когда вы будете погружены в капсулу, и вашу жену убивают на ваших глазах, становится интереснее. Сам сюжет в игре мне не нравится, в 3-й части мне показался интереснее. В игру добавили стройку, я поначалу её полностью игнорировал, но потом начались квесты на защиту поселений и я втянулся,  но строительство очень плохо проработано в игре, из минусов я подчеркнул - нельзя убирать весь мусор который жутко раздражает, нельзя сносить поломанные дома, и в некоторых поселениях даже деревья не срубить,хз почему но есть конкретные деревья которые нельзя срубывать,хоть они и в зоне действия мастерской.И ещё минус в том что когда строишь дом из стен и полов, не всегда получается в примкнуть их в нужное место, игра их носит по всему,но не на нужное место, кто играл и строил, тот поймет о чём я.В игре радует что добавили ещё всяких тварей, и сделали им разные уровни сложности (легендарный, светящийся и др.) Ещё отмечу то, что в игру добавили реактивный ранец для брони,он конечно не далеко поднимает,но прикольно, и не так страшно падать. Сделали больше напарников разных типов, и в игре больше романсов чем в 3-й части! В целом игра крутая, поиски сына, строительство, защита поселений, романы и интим, не дадут вам заскучать!
РЕКОМЕНДУЮ
P.s - Ставьте лайки, добавляйтесь в друзья. Спасибо!!!

185851119.review:
Fallout 4 od Bethesda Game Studios to gra, która miała być ambitnym rozwinięciem uznanej serii, ale niestety okazała się najbardziej przekombinowaną i nieudaną częścią. W porównaniu do Fallout: New Vegas od Obsidian Entertainment, Fallout 4 wypada blado, oferując płytką fabułę, uproszczony system dialogów i rozgrywkę pełną irytujących mechanik.
Jednym z największych problemów Fallouta 4 jest brak głębi fabularnej i dialogowej. W New Vegas gracz miał do dyspozycji złożoną historię, bogatą w moralne dylematy, frakcje o różnych interesach i możliwość realnego wpływu na świat gry. Fallout 4, zamiast tego, serwuje jednowymiarową fabułę skupioną na poszukiwaniu syna, która szybko staje się przewidywalna i mało angażująca. System dialogów został drastycznie uproszczony – cztery opcje odpowiedzi (z których często tylko jedna ma sens) odbierają możliwość wyboru, jaką oferowały wcześniejsze gry.
Wprowadzenie mechaniki budowy osad wydawało się ciekawym dodatkiem, ale w praktyce jest to jeden z najbardziej frustrujących elementów gry. System jest nieintuicyjny, ograniczony przez toporne sterowanie i silnik gry, który wyraźnie nie był przystosowany do takiej funkcji. Gracze zmuszeni są godzinami walczyć z fizyką gry i chaotycznym interfejsem, aby stworzyć cokolwiek funkcjonalnego. Co gorsza, gra wymaga od gracza opieki nad osadami i odpierania ciągłych ataków, co staje się nużące i odciąga od eksploracji postapokaliptycznego świata.
Największym paradoksem jest fakt, że wcześniejsza gra Bethesdy – Skyrim, działająca na tym samym silniku – oferuje znacznie bardziej spójną i satysfakcjonującą rozgrywkę. Skyrim, mimo swoich wad, wciąga w świat fantasy z bogatymi frakcjami, ciekawymi zadaniami i modyfikacjami, które nie tylko poprawiają, ale i rozszerzają rozgrywkę. Fallout 4, choć powstał na tej samej technologii, wydaje się mniej przemyślany i wyraźnie ucierpiał przez ambicję wprowadzenia zbyt wielu nowości naraz. (Hearthfire top)


Nie będę pisał opisowych recenzji, jak robiłem to wcześniej specjalnie dla tej gry... bo ja właściwie nie mam co omawiać. Skończyłem grę na 4,5h i niech tak zostanie. Nie zapowiada się, bym kiedykolwiek tknął te grę ponownie. Solidne 4/10.

185814998.review:
Okay so i'm gonna say it cause I don't care what the Fallout New Vegas People think, Fallout 4 is the greatest Fallout Game ever made.

You wanna know why? Its playable from day one. No need to mod the game to run on current day hardware (looking at you New Vegas and 3)
Isn't a live service (looking at you Fallout 76)
And isn't an isometric (most new players are scared of old isometric games where you can't just shoot someone in the face like its call of duty (and I have to admit its way simpler to just do that))

And you know what, yeah it does have issues. The writing isn't as good sometimes, the scenery is about what you expect for a nuclear apocalypse in BAWSTUN of all places. But you know what, its still the coolest one. You can literally do whatever you want as soon as you jump your happy ass out of Vault 111 and into the world. Hell you can just ignore the main quest line as long as you want with no repercussions. Yeah you can also do this in New Vegas and 3, but its not the most ideal. 

In Fallout 4 that hardly matters. I once made a save where I ran in a B-line towards the Glowing Sea, and I had to be sneaky to get past all the Radscorpions and Deathclaws, but I did it and got to the nuke vault, terribly under leveled to even be out there. But I did it. And this doesn't even begin to mention the building system. I personally don't much care for it but I recognize that it gives you a lot of tools to be creative, and the DLC's absolutely add to the experience. Especially the automation one. 

Far Harbor is by far the best DLC and probably should have just been its own Fallout Game because of how good it was. All the other DLC's are good with exceptions here and there but they're minor gripes at best. 

You can get immersed in the world or just play as a complete barbarian 10 strength all luck idiot savant and still have fun. 

If I was to point to my favourite part of Fallout 4 its genuinely the Power Armor. In previous games, Power Armor felt more like a gimmick, like it was just another piece of apparel you could slap on. Yes you needed power armor training as a perk to even use it, but for most builds you really didn't need it. So it was a gimmick. In this game any moron can grab a fusion core, slap that bitch into the suit and you are off to the races. Power Armor training as a perk to me personally, doesn't make much sense. Cause lets be serious this is a big, chunky, powered suit of armor, that you would not feel the weight of even if you are literally wearing about 8 Toyota Tacoma's worth of armor around your entire body. Plus I think that this being one of the most technologically advanced settings for a Fallout Game (The Commonwealth) it makes a lot of sense that there would be technical knowledge that could be found around the wasteland for raiders or mechanics to find and figure out how to use. It also just sounds good, feels good to use, and overall is a far superior implementation of Power Armor compared to New Vegas or 3. Fallout 1, 2 and the Isometrics im excluding only cause I have not played them yet but I plan on it. 

Go buy the game when its on sale, and I only say that cause Bethesda has enough money as it is. Its not that the content isn't worth the money its just that this is a Bethesda game so save every penny you can cause you know Godd Toward is going to snatch your wallet at some point anyways when you decide to buy something and then regret it. (Sorry Starfield fans your game is mid as hell.)

10/10 would wander the wasteland again.

185761197.review:
If I reviewed this game when I first played it years ago, I'd have given it a great score. Thankfully I am no longer a literal child and can now see this game for the missed opportunity it is.

This game is just lazy in so many ways. Buggy as hell and runs like shit, it's story and writing is often worse than or on par with stories I've read in high school creative writing classes. The factions are stupid. Institute is stupid and makes no sense. Minutemen are barely a faction, which you become the leader of at the very start of the game because they were wiped out and you need to build up. Decent idea ruined by the fact they do literally nothing with it. The railroad exist, and are a main faction for some reason. The brotherhood is fine I guess. Least bad.

Gunplay is fun, though I only ever run semi auto's because some genius decided that automatic weapons to less than half as much damage per bullet. Melee combat is uninteresting, just run at enemies and press m1 until they die.  Exploration is pretty decent, locations are varied and occasionally interesting. Looting is fun, I like to hoard stuff. Crafting is serviceable. Power armor is fun, I love upgrading it. Unfortunate the devs are morons and give it to you at the literal start of the game, and basically make it impossible to not constantly get more.

Role-play is nonexistent, dialogue seldom gives you the option to be anything other than a Jesus Christ level good Samaritan, or the same thing but snarkier. No, the sarcastic dialogue options often being amusing does not make up for the fact you can only ever say: Yes, No, Yes but funny, or whaa? You can try to be evil but its pretty pointless. The companions you play with are alright, one of the few things I like about the game is that the game explores your companions a bit more that other entries. Unfortunate there is nothing to explore with them really, you cant influence them at all like in new vegas. They just exposit at you for a while then give you a perk at max affinity. Its impossible to make them hate you unless you try, except Strong, who is impossible to make like you. Great companions like Nick Valentine aren't enough to save this game though. 

The DLCs are decent, Nuka world adds fun content to explore but it also written terribly and has little role-play value. Far harbor is the "best" DLC simply because Bethesda actually tried, don't confuse it being good compared to the rest of the game as being good in general. The robot one is fun, building robots is cool. Others are just item packs that should have been basegame content. Overall they are all fun (except the vault one which sucks ass) 

IDk why I still like this game. Its prob just nostalgia. If you buy, get it because of the gameplay, which is simply passable, or the exploration which is decently fun. The game is easy on any difficulty, survival will keep you on your toes for a bit, and inevitably just irritate you. 

Settlement building exists, and is fun I guess, but don't expect any of the time you spend building them to amount to anything.

Mods expectedly make the game much better. The problem is that this game sucks in so many ways, eventually you add so many mods that you start asking yourself why you don't just play a different game.

This review is born out of spite and disapointment. This game could have been amazing, but it isnt.Overall, only play this game if it is your skyrim, or you want a cheap experience. Its rushed and buggy, and uses the community as a crutch to make it less shitty.  Still, I enjoy this game for some reason. Please don't play it, get a better game made by a company who deserves the money more.

This game is awesome in so many respects! Yet, the second shoe drops which leaves this title bereft of logical direction. The scope of this game was intended to be mind boggling and it was, until reality and time caught up with Bethesda and they were, obviously forced to bring an incomplete and trimmed down version of Fallout 4 to the public. Unfortunately, it was much the same with Skyrim. Then the modders completely destructed the good parts opting for their own version of what Bethesda had intended to be a complete game.

 There is no doubt that Fallout 4 is a phenomenal game, except for some very annoying and frustrating aspects. 
First and foremost is the settlement happiness conundrum. I mean, WTF?!? Just building a structure from scratch is annoying and difficult enough but to link settlement happiness to it is nearly suicidal. For example: I have 24 settlers at my Sanctuary settlement. I have 83 water; 100 power; 45 food; and 42 sheltered beds. I also have 6, 4th level clinics, 5 bars, 5 clothing stores; and 4 clinics, ( these are all level 3 and 4). I also have 3 dogs, 2 cats , 6 pommel horses, 4 weight benches and a barbers chair. How in the hell am I deficient in happiness? I have far more than any settler could possibly want, yet I can't get them to be happy!?!? WHY is this so torturously difficult? It doesn't make sense, nor does it promote the game.  Settlers just leave their jobs unexpectedly, leaving the settlement bereft of any assistance or benefits. I mean, WTF???!!!?: Who or what decides this action? What is the cause of this? And why??? Personally, I couldn't care less about the achievement, but the game has to be fluid and as a result of the settlement reactions, it breaks the game. The fault is Bethesda's not the public's. 

Unfortunately, there are far too many bugs, glitches and flat out failures in Bethesda's programming to treat this as an AAA game. It's a fractured and pared down version that the "big wigs" at Bethesda thought they could get away with. Welcome to Trumps America!!!!!!!!

185701700.review:
Après la parenthèse Fallout: New Vegas, la franchise revient avec ce Fallout 4, qui est en réalité le 5ème volet de la franchise (je ne compte pas Fallout Tactics qui est un titre à part).

Si Fallout 3 et Fallout: New Vegas étaient assez similaires du point de vue de la qualité graphique, nous passons ici au niveau supérieur, et le jeu est très beau par rapport à ce que nous avons connu jusqu'ici. Les personnages, en revanche, restent relativement rigides avec des expressions faciales très limitées, mais on ne s'en étonnera pas étant donné qu'on est chez Bethesda...

Pas trop de surprise sur la partie création du personnage : on reste sur le système S.P.E.C.I.A.L pour les caractéristiques, et les outils permettant de designer le visage du héros sont toujours assez limités.

L'histoire débute avant la tombée des bombes. Vous vivez dans un foyer typique des années 50, constitué d'un couple avec un enfant (pour rappel, dans Fallout, nous sommes dans un monde alternatif au nôtre, resté dans une esthétique et des valeurs typiques des années 50 alors que nous sommes en 2077). Si vous avez créé un homme, vous incarnez le mari, et si vous avez créé une femme, vous incarnez la femme.

C'est la panique lorsque les sirènes d'alerte annoncent une attaque atomique imminente, et vous êtes amené d'urgence dans un abri avec d'autres personnes, puis mis dans un caisson cryogénique. Votre mari ou votre femme, selon le cas, est placé(e) dans un caisson face à vous avec votre fils.

Un jour, vous vous réveillez brièvement pour assister à une scène déchirante : des inconnus ouvrent la capsule de votre mari / femme, l'abattent sous vos yeux et kidnappent votre fils, Shaun. Vous êtes ensuite replongé(e) à nouveau dans un sommeil forcé. C'est des années plus tard que vous êtes enfin libéré(e) de votre caisson et découvrez que toutes les personnes de votre abri ont été tuées. Vous sortez alors de l'abri pour découvrir un monde dévasté.

La mise en place de l'histoire (ce que j'ai décrit plus haut ainsi que quelques événements qui suivent) se déroule de manière scriptée, et cela fonctionne plutôt bien. Le jeu s'ouvre un peu plus tard lorsque vous avez atteint un certain point de scénario.

Le gameplay reste relativement similaire aux deux épisodes précédents, et un système de construction a été ajouté.

Personnellement, je n'ai pas été vraiment convaincu par le système de construction que je ne trouve pas très réussi, mais pourquoi pas. L'idée est de développer des communautés en mettant en place couchages, cultures, électricité, systèmes de défense... De temps en temps, vous verrez une urgence alors que vous êtes parti ailleurs, et il faudra venir défendre la communauté contre une attaque de pillards. Tout ceci est facultatif, donc au pire vous pouvez vous concentrer sur les quêtes si ceci ne vous intéresse pas.

Le niveau d'écriture des quêtes est en deçà de ce qu'on a pu avoir dans les deux premiers Fallout et dans New Vegas, mais l'histoire reste intéressante et développe le lore. Il faudra encore une fois prendre parti entre différentes factions, et il y aura 3 grandes fins différentes en fonction des choix.

Fallout 4 n'est pas le meilleur Fallout, mais c'est le plus beau à ce jour. Si vous aimez la franchise, il reste un épisode important, et si vous la découvrez, c'est peut-être le meilleur choix si l'aspect graphique des plus anciens peut vous rebuter.

185678750.review:
Overall Good Game, with a great world to explore and experience. There are a bunch of unique characters in this game that you will care about, and although the quests arn't the best in the fallout series there still good. Although the new patch broke alot of mods, the Modding community has carried the longevity of this game, and it's thanks to them and the Devs that this game has a ton of replayablity and customization.

Bethesda really tried to push their limits with this game with new weapon augmentation, equippable power armor, settlement building, and unique followers and characters, but fell short with some of the quest in the game. This game overall was a move in right direction by Bethesda, but they left some of the important elements of the Fallout universe behind; the Grim atmosphere, the horror atmosphere, and the unique small world building quest that added a great depth to the world.

For what this game has to show, it's a Solid game compared to the Market and it's better than most. With its unique world, unique characters, settlement building system, and the ability to explore the world at your own pace this game is a Great Game. It a solid 8/10.

185651097.review:
At the beginning of this review, I would like to apologize to all non-Polish speakers for the absence of the English language in this review, which is present in my other reviews. This is due to a significant character limit being exceeded. I apologize and wish you a good day/evening ;).
"Fallout 4" czyli gra nominowana do GoTY (Game of The Year) w 2015 roku wyprodukowana przez studio Bethesda i produkcja zła prawie pod każdym względem. Ale od początku, zagrałem w "Fallouta 4" bo kolega mnie namówił, kupiłem na wyprzedaży za 20 PLN i od razu wyj*bałem w kąt z powodu beznadziejnej optymalizacji. Potem wracałem sporadycznie aby wyłączyć grę zaraz po prologu i narzekać na jej stan techniczny do końca dnia. Jednak jakiś czas temu wróciłem do Fallouta 4 za namową znajomego i pomocą moda lekko poprawiającego FPS'y w grze, doszedłem do misji w concordzie (miasto w grze aby było jasne) czyli nowy rekord ale potem znowu mi się odechciało z powodu zwykłego nudnego gameplayu, bo ani to fabuła ciekawa nie jest (chociaż z początku zapowiadała się naprawdę dobrze i myślałem, że będzie to gra w stylu "Metro") ani gameplay zbyt dobry nie był, RPG'owe mechaniki były fatalne, zadania poboczne niemożliwie nudne, animacje też skiepściałe i nawet nie wspominam tutaj o stanie technicznym gry który jest po tych niemalże 10 latach od premiery gorszy niż Cyberpunk 2077 w 2020, tam glitche były obecne i to w absurdalnie wielkiej ilości ale z tego co wiem to nigdy nie było baga który bezpośrednio uniemożliwiaj ukończenie gry, niby było coś w stylu zapadania się pojazdu pod ziemię ale nigdy to nie umożliwiało ukończenia gry, w przeciwieństwie do Fallouta 4 (do czego za chwilę przejdę). Tak się akurat złożyło, że wczoraj wieczorem instalował mi się "Ghostrunner 2" na Epic Games i nie wiedziałem w co zagrać no to tak patrzę i "dlaczego by w Fallouta 4 nie zagrać?" ale tym razem uparłem się, że choćby nie wiem co to będę robić jedynie fabułę. Po około trzech godzinach gry, dotarłem do Diamond City i tam się zaczęło, miałem znaleźć detektywa Nica Valentine, no to idę go szukać, no i wpadam do krypty 114 z minigunem w ręku (warto wspomnieć w tym miejscu, że grałem na normalnym poziomie trudności) i... umarłem, pierwszy raz, drugi raz, trzeci raz, czwarty raz i z godzinę mógłbym tak wymieniać, tak się wkurzyłem, że zmieniłem grę na łatwy poziom trudności, tam też raz po raz padałem, nie miałem już wtedy żadnego leczenia i byłem na 2 lub 3 strzały, wrócić się też nie mogłem bo wcześniej starałem się wymijać przeciwników ale to też zeżarło mi sporo życia. Wtedy więc aby jakoś to zrobić, postanowiłem się skradać, ale tutaj mam kolejny poważny minus czyli beznadziejne AI przeciwników którzy mogli mnie skradającego się zobaczyć dosłownie zza pleców, wtedy to dostałem istnej furii i wyj*bałem te gę grę wracając na pulpit w tempie natychmiastowym. Następnego dnia postanowiłem dać tej grze jeszcze jedną, tym razem ostatnią szansę, oczywiście wy*ebałem się kilka razy od pierwszego punktu zapisu ale to też wtedy odkryłem magiczny sposób na przetrwanie czyli kody, tak tak, nazywajcie mnie cheaterem ale dam sobie rękę uciąć, że wiele osób czytających tę recenzję zrobiłoby na moim miejscu podobnie. No i wpisałem komendę "player.resethealth" i wtedy nagminnie używałem tej komendy aż do końca misji "detektyw o stalowym sercu", wtedy to musiałem ponownie udać się do Diamond City i porozmawiać tam z detektywem, kiedy byłem już gotowy do rozmowy musiałem zrobić jedną niepozorną czynność która okazała się jednak niemożliwa do wykonania czyli kliknąć klawisz "e" aby usiąść, niby proste ale za każdym pier*olonym razem wyskakiwał mi komunikat "nie można wykonać czynności w stanie walki" wtedy dostałem istne "CO ku*wa?!". Nic na ten błąd nie pomagało, wczytanie ostatniego zapisu, wyłączenie i włączenie gry/komputera, po porostu nic! Ten błąd również uniemożliwił mi ukończenie głównej ścieżki fabularnej gry. Tak wiem, niby mógłbym zapytać się społeczności czy to na Steamie czy to na Reddicie czy innym YouTubie lub Internecie, ale jeżeli szanowna Bethesda nie dostarczyła mi dobrego tytułu, dopracowanego pod względem historii czy gameplayu to ja też nie będę się wysilać i marnować swojego czasu na taką bezpłciową grę jaką jest "Fallout 4" który teraz może (w mojej opinii) się przywitać z innymi podobnymi jej grami w 10 najgorszych gier kiedykolwiek stworzonych które jakimś dziwnym trafem ujrzały światło dzienne. Ale starczy tego gadania o minusach bo aby to była rzetelna recenzja trzeba też powiedzieć co nie co o plusach. Mogę tutaj pochwalić świetnie oddany postapokaliptyczny klimat gry który jest niemal bezbłędny pod każdym względem, świat jest pustawy i zniszczony poprzez wojnę atomową. Design postaci, no może nie postaci bo to bardziej minus niż plus jednak design przeciwników (nie bandytów) takich jak zmutowane komary, jaszczury czy inne przedziwne potwory, które rzeczywiście wyglądają obrzydliwie (w tym dobrym sensie), ale to w pełni gry nie ratuje. Jeszcze muzyka która... o Jezu... "fu*king masterpiece", tylko te słowa mogą chociaż w części oddać jak muzyka jest w tej grze genialna chociaż muzyka to zawsze był punkt na plus w serii "Fallout", ale niestety w kwestii audio to tylko muzyka plusuje bo rzeczy takie jak voice acting są co najwyżej średnie (w mojej subiektywnej opinii). Na pochwałę zasługuje jeszcze cały prolog gry który jest naprawdę ciekawy ale szkoda, że w późniejszej części gry tak to zostało wykastrowane, chociaż mogę się mylić bo jestem na poziomie jak wcześniej wspomniałem Diamond City, ale jak do tego czasu nie było za dobrze. Dobrze też wyglądają różne pancerze, bronie i tym podobne pierdoły, ale chyba najlepszą rzeczą był... kreator postaci który przez pierwsze 40 minut był świetny, czułem się dosłownie jak w "The Sims 4" XD. Ale pozostaje pytanie, co zrobiłem po tym kiedy dostałem białej gorączki po ujrzeniu glitcha z krzesłem? Oddałem się w pełni kodom, czyli dodałem do swojego ekwipunku najlepsze możliwe bronie, odpaliłem god moda i niszczyłem wszystko na swojej drodze, chociaż to dało mi odrobinę funu więc na plus :D. Kiedy piszę tę recenzję to zauważyłem, że przed odpaleniem "Fallouta 4" na GOG'u (Good Old Games) miałem problem z instalacją "MGS1" (Metal Gear Solid) "i Little Nightmares", ale już po odinstalowaniu "Fallouta 4" obie te gry się zainstalowały XD.
Ostatecznie jeżeli miałbym ocenić "Fallouta 4" to powiedziałbym, że to o GoTY z "Wiedźminem 3" nie ma najmniejszych szans walczyć.
Moja ocena: 3.5/10
Za 80 PLN całkowicie odradzam kupowanie tej gry, ale na przecenie lub w formie klucza na Enebie czy Instant Gaming za jakieś 20 PLN to polecam o ile lubicie rozwalać wszystko i wszystkich na swojej drodze, oczywiście polecam też moda na FPS'y (ja osobiście pobrałem go z Nexus moda) bo inaczej nie da się grać.
Dziękuję za poświęcony tej recenzji czas i życzę miłego dnia/wieczoru ;).

As old as it is, if you can get the complete pack for $10, it's money well spent.

This game is definitely less boring if you find a list of "quests worth doing" before finishing the main quest, but playing a game alongside a walkthrough/wiki/forum posts may not be for everyone.

Tl;dr: this game is ultimately good but there's a lot of junk in between the good bits,

If you're introducing someone to the franchise, start here, then have them play the older titles (probably New Vegas next). If you get all the DLCs, do not install them into your game until level 15-20. Roaming robots are annoying. Most DLCs' content isn't accessible until then anyway. 185602777.review:
I slept on the Fallout series for a long time, assuming I wouldn't like it because I'm not that into post-apocalyptic settings and I had previously tried Fallout: New Vegas on a whim and wasn't that into it. After the TV series came out and I'd seen enough recommendations for Fallout 4 as a good place to start for new players (and after resisting the urge to play Skyrim for the millionth time), I finally decided to dive in and I'm so happy I did. 

Fallout 4 is great. It has that signature Bethesda polish where the game has tons of ridiculous glitches but still manages to charm you with its wonderful characters (Nick Valentine and John Hancock were my favorites), silly sense of humor, and delightful set dressing (seriously, I looked forward to opening a bathroom stall to find the walls covered in plungers or finding a teddy bear smoking a cigar in a random room). The story was intriguing and something I really enjoyed sinking my teeth in, and I thought there were plenty of weapons that offered different ways to play, though I found myself ignoring melee in favor of having a short-range shotgun, mid-range pistol, and long-range sniper rifle with me at all times. I aimed for a high-charisma character which is not something I would normally go for, but I found it suited me quite well and I was pretty happy to lean away from the stealth-based character builds that I would normally choose for a game like Skyrim. 

I could go on and on about this game, but ultimately all I really want to say in this review is this: if you've been holding out on this series for some reason, it really is worth giving a shot. It's a lot more fun and interesting than I thought it would be.

185592879.review: Já joguei os Fallout 1,2,3 e New Vegas. Dito isso, considero que o 4 tem novos elementos novos e outros ruins; Por um lado, o sistema de diálogo perdeu sua característica de RPG e se tornou simplório. Você não lê mais a frase inteira que seu personagem dirá, somente uma prévia da intenção de cada escolha de resposta. Contudo, por outro lado, alguns novos elementos ajudam na imersão: os ghouls saem de frestas nas quais o jogador não pode entrar e que não permite vê-los até que estejam próximos demais; os mole rats agora irrompem do solo como animais escavadores de verdade; os Deathclaw podem erguê-lo do chão, o que dá uma adrenalina legal. Os raiders conversam entre si enquanto você está oculto, em vez de apenas soltarem barks de fala durante os ataques. A função de atirar protegido por uma cobertura também é interessante, assim como o sistema de customização de equipamentos que está mais amplo. Este é, portanto, um Fallout "agridoce", que perdeu por um lado e ganhou de outro.

185528574.review:
Fallout 4 is an open-world RPG that blends exploration, combat, and crafting in a post-apocalyptic world. Set in the ruins of Boston, the game follows the Sole Survivor as they search for their missing son while navigating the dangers and factions of the Commonwealth.

The game excels in world-building, offering a richly detailed environment filled with secrets, stories, and memorable locations. The crafting and settlement-building systems add depth, allowing players to customize weapons, armor, and even entire communities. The combat is much improved from previous entries, with tighter gunplay and more responsive controls.

However, Fallout 4 has its flaws. The dialogue system feels simplified compared to earlier games, limiting player choice and role-playing depth. The story, while serviceable, doesn’t reach the emotional highs of its predecessors. Additionally, bugs and performance issues, a hallmark of Bethesda titles, can disrupt the experience.

Fallout 4 is a solid entry in the franchise, offering a fun sandbox for exploration and crafting, though it leans more toward action than traditional RPG elements.

A great choice for fans of open-world games, but it may not satisfy those seeking deep storytelling. Definetly not on par with its predecessor... [b]7.5/10[/b].

185517558.review:
War. War never changes.

In the year 1945, my great-great grandfather, serving in the army, wondered when he’d get to go home to his wife and the son he’d never seen. He got his wish when the US ended World War II by dropping atomic bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki.

The World awaited Armageddon; instead, something miraculous happened. We began to use atomic energy not as a weapon, but as a nearly limitless source of power.

People enjoyed luxuries once thought the realm of science fiction. Domestic robots, fusion-powered cars, portable computers. But then, in the 21st century, people awoke from the American dream.

Years of consumption lead to shortages of every major resource. The entire world unraveled. Peace became a distant memory. It is now the year 2077. We stand on the brink of total war, and I am afraid. For myself, for my wife, for my infant son – because if my time in the army taught me one thing: it’s that war, war never changes.

185402331.review:
After a grand total of 3.880 hours in this game, none of them modded, most spent in survival, here is my drunken review:

Fallout 4 is nowhere near finished, nor well-written enough, to catch your attention at first glance.
Yet, it’s still more enjoyable than most other titles in the series. Yes, still far from the best.
Let me explain.

Most of you have already played Fallout 4, additionally, most of those who dislike it are the FONV femboys, that are worldwide grandmasters in d1kriding on false information.

But, I’ll half-ass a quote I’ve heard from a YouTuber; “Fallout 4 is the embodiment of missed opportunities,” and it truly, TRULY is.

It is a great game, by barely subpar means. Meaning it’s decent to the average consumer. Which must’ve been Bethesda’s goal.
Otherwise I might cry.

But a deep sense of nostalgia for a game, I played as little as 7 years ago, for the first time at 16 years old; Fallout 2, really kicked in.

The odd sensation, near thirst for exploring this world in 3D took over me.
Nearly as if, I already had a personal connection to this game?

I have since collected a grand total of 17.500+ hours in all Fallout games combined.
Yes, some of you may say that’s overkill, I call it “unemployment.”

But as of why I mention this, is that this world has become a deep part of me.
A fictional timeline, worth nearly 560 years of history, which I know better than my own.

I could go yapping further about how this franchise became so close to heart, but none of this would’ve happened, have I started out with Fallout 4.

Don’t get me wrong; you haven’t experienced the world of Fallout until you’ve additionally played Fallout 4 in survival.
But it’s just incomparable to the earlier games in the franchise.

As of why, I’ll half-ass another quote from a YouTuber; “don’t get me wrong, I love Cyberpunk 2077, but imagine what its timeframe and budget could’ve made, in the hands of these guys (Interplay’s Obsidian).”

Fallout 4 brought action and more immediate gameplay, which can somewhat satisfy the average consumer.
And that’s the root of it all; funding. Money. Cash. Growth.

And Fallout 4 grew the franchise by miles, no doubt.
But it is not what represents the world of Fallout. 
Its storylines are less narrow than that. Its political implications are more complicated, more about personal morals, and not doing what’s obviously right.
It had “replayability,” your choices had major impacts on your character and your abilities, hell, even the dialogue.

To say that Fallout 4 is a role-playing game is a stretch.
There’s not much of a role to play, more of a show to experience.
Not to say it’s a bad one of that, but it’s not noteworthy by any means.
That is, if you haven’t played the earlier titles.

We all wish Bethesda would drop their egotistical high ground, and just collaborate for a title that both fans and newcomers will enjoy.
But much like how I’d like to pipe Piper irl, that’s just not gonna happen.

The “brutality,” so to say, the atmosphere, the interest in characters, the experiences needed to truly enunciate this world, cannot be told through Bethesda.

We’ll have to settle for “decent at best” titles by Bethesda, only god knows what Microsoft will do with them.

My honest opinion is, that if this perception of quality persists, the Fallout franchise will surely die.
And I’d hate to see that happen.


If you come to ask why I went from Fallout 2 to Fallout 4; broke household.
If you come to ask if I recommend this game to the median gamer? Yes, absolutely.

Fallout is iconic, not because of Bethesda, but because it was the introduction to a world of nuclear apocalypse to many, many people of our generations.
And to not experience this world first-hand, would be no short of a tragedy.
Even if that meant only having played Fallout 4.

185402131.review:
[h1]Um Guia de Sobrevivência na “Terra da Mãe dos Planos Que Não Deram Certo”[/h1]

Após um pouco mais de 400 horas posso contar um pouco da experiência com esse jogo que realmente apreciei.
Bem-vindo ao mundo pós-apocalíptico de Fallout 4, onde a palavra "sobrevivência" ganha todo um novo significado. Aqui vai um resumo para os aspirantes a sobreviventes:

[b]História:[/b]
Você acorda em um abrigo nuclear, congelado por sabe-se lá quantos anos, só para descobrir que a sociedade passou por um makeover zumbi-mad max com uma pitada de “Opa, cadê a civilização?” Agora sua missão é encontrar seu filho sequestrado e, enquanto isso, se perguntar se foi uma boa ideia sair da cama naquele dia.

[b]Gráficos:[b]
Para um jogo de quase 10 anos atrás os gráficos passam a sensação de que está jogando um jogo e não vivendo em um filme B pós-apocalíptico. Se você gosta de cenários desolados, com mutantes tentando te devorar, aqui é o seu lugar!

[b]Jogabilidade:[/b]
Construção de Bases: Aparentemente, ser um sobrevivente do apocalipse nuclear não é suficiente. Você também deve ser um arquiteto de primeira. Prepare-se para construir seu próprio rancho dos sonhos – com um toque de radiação, claro.

[b]Companheiros:[/b] Desde um cachorro leal até um robô sarcástico e um super mutante gentil (sério, um super mutante gentil), você nunca estará sozinho – mesmo quando desejar que estivesse. Cada um à sua maneira, e com bônus que vão te ajudar nos piores momentos.

[b]Personalização de Armas:[/b] Se você já sonhou em transformar uma espingarda em uma máquina de fazer purê de mutantes, seus sonhos se tornaram realidade.

[b]Dificuldade:[/b]
Prepare-se para muitas e muitas mortes. Lembra daquele encontro com aquele "Deathclaw"? Sim, você vai morrer. Muitas vezes. Bem-vindo ao apocalipse!

[b]Missões:[/b]
São muitas (e acredite quando eu digo muitas) missões que vão te deixar com a sensação desde Garoto de Entregas até O Destino da Commonwealth está em minhas mãos. Algumas engraçadas, outras com um tema mais sério, mas todas que vão te fazer se entreter por horas e horas.

[b]DLCs:[/b]
A Bethesda se preocupou em criar conteúdo que varia entre 20 a 40 horas de campanha, então mais missões vêm aí (e olha que eu nem joguei o [b]Fallout London[/b] ainda...)

[b]Momentos Memoráveis:[/b]
- A busca por água potável que não brilha à noite.

- Tropeçar em um bando de raiders que parecem ter saído de um filme de zumbis dos anos 80.

- Descobrir que a radiação pode não ser a pior coisa que você encontrará.

Em resumo, Fallout 4 é um passeio maluco através de um mundo onde cada decisão pode (e provavelmente vai) levar à sua morte. Mas, ei, pelo menos você pode fazer isso em grande estilo com uma armadura Power Armor personalizada!

Prós:

- Mundo imersivo e vasto.

- Diversão ilimitada em personalização.

- Companheiros carismáticos que te farão rir e chorar.

Contras:

- Possível síndrome de “O que eu estava fazendo mesmo?”.

- A constante sensação de que a próxima esquina pode ser sua última.

Prepare-se para uma aventura inesquecível, onde o lema é: Sobreviver, construir e, se tudo mais falhar, corra!

This Fallout is much more of a sandbox experience than a cinematic story type beat. 

You won’t enjoy it if you want something captivating and exciting, because it just doesn’t do that as everything basically sits around until you get around to doing the busy work for everyone in the game. Due to this it feels rather dead and I guess the setting gimmick is dead on because every npc feels like a bot and the world devoid of life.

I think it lacks a lot of charm and quality of narrative, which is fixed a bit in Far Harbor, but that’s only a short while.

I still liked it, enjoyed it even, but I didn’t love it the same way and for same reasons I loved Skyrim.

So tack on some mods, run around, make your own fun, and replay Fallout New Vegas afterwards.


P.S. The paid mods are stupid as hell, if you really wanted to support modders, contract them out for a piecewise DLC, not price-gouge users for this crap.

185399643.review:
Habiendo jugado los 3 juegos en 3D de Fallout: Fallout 3, New Vegas y 4 (Fallout 76 no cuenta).
El 4 es el que más amor odio me a dado…

Por un lado, el sistema de diálogos es pésimo, tienes para elegir entre 4 opciones y no sabes que es lo que va a decir tu personaje cuando respondas cualquiera de ellas, es un fastidio tener que descargar mods para arreglar eso cuando ya tendría que estar añadido de base como ocurría en juegos anteriores.

En esta entrega, tiene un sistema de asentamientos que a mi parecer me gusta y es  lo que más me a llevado a echar horas pero a la vez lo que más amor-odio me ha dado… 
El sistema de asentamientos permite al jugador acoger a gente del yermo en diferentes zonas concretas del mundo y asegurarse de que tengan todo lo necesario para su supervivencia, pudiéndoles construir alojamientos, torres defensivas, bombas de agua, etc…
Ese sistema me parece que es muy divertido, ya que permite incluso personalizar la armadura y armas de la gente de cada asentamiento. El punto negativo es que hay más de 30 asentamientos, los cuales siempre necesitan tu ayuda ya que pueden ser atacados incluso cuando el jugador no está y saldrá la notificación… Eso lleva a que siempre tengas que estar llendo a ayudar si no tienen las defensas adecuadas.

Como contraparte y punto muy positivo, es que el juego su sistema de combate es preciso y cómodo y que las misiones aunque hay de todo, muchas de ellas llegan a ser muy divertidas e interesantes.

Yo lo recomiendo porque es un Fallout, y no deja de ser muy divertido

185354456.review:
Fallout 4 is a truly remarkable game that I have thoroughly enjoyed diving into. It's not just a game; it's an expansive open-world experience that captivates players in ways few games can. The vastness of the wasteland is breathtaking, as it allows me to roam freely, exploring a post-apocalyptic landscape filled with remnants of a once-thriving civilization. Each corner of the Commonwealth holds secrets waiting to be discovered, from abandoned buildings to hidden treasures, making every excursion an adventure that I anticipate eagerly.
One of the standout features of Fallout 4 that I particularly admire is its intricate crafting system. This mechanism allows players to gather resources from their surroundings and transform them into useful items, weapons, and even intricate settlements. The sense of creativity and customization it offers is invigorating, as I can modify my gear to fit my play style or create unique structures to establish a foothold in this harsh world. The crafting system allows for endless experimentation, inviting me to think strategically about the materials I collect and how I can best utilize them to enhance my survival chances.
As I traverse the desolate landscapes, I often find myself immersed in the deep lore and storytelling that the game offers. Each character I encounter has their own backstory and motives, enriching the narrative tapestry that unfolds before me.

放到现在也很惊艳的开放世界角色扮演游戏，非常经典，内容非常丰富，游戏氛围营造得很棒，UI设定极具特色。
内容玩法在现在很多游戏里仍然是主流，包括基本的经验技能加点、资源搜索、探索解密、偷窃撬锁、基地建造、工作种田、装备升级、武器改造、武装机甲、锻造合成、同伴随从、营地清理、猎杀头目跟附魔装备掉落；超多任务支线跟可探索的地点，有重复性高的也有很有趣的，主线还有阵容选择跟多结局。完成任务的方式也各种各样，支线剧情也会影响对应主线；可以当老好人讨好各阵容体验完整剧情内容，也能当法外狂徒杀穿废土，整体的自由度还是很高的。当然最重要的是有超多的mod可以提升游戏体验。
但是游戏细节上很多比较随意，游戏的BUG非常非常的多，而且B社似乎是不太重视修补的，对待玩家和mod的态度也比较傲慢，最近其他作品也不是很成功，辐射系列的后续发展前景不是很乐观。

185218127.review:
A pesar de las críticas que ha recibido Fallout 4, yo me lo he pasado como un enano! :D

Bethesda dio en su día un salto de gigante con Fallout 3 llevando la franquicia al 3D, y tras ello, llegó el New Vegas, el cual a seguia la misma fórmula pero con mejoras en el sistema de apuntado así como en la disposición del mundo abierto (entre otras cosas) haciéndolo un producto todavía más redondo. 

Después de estos dos juegazos llegó el 4 en el que si bien es cierto que perdió algunas cosillas de los anteriores sigue manteniendo la esencia. Además está más modernizado (he intentado jugar hace poco al New Vegas y que mal le sientan los años) por lo que es mi recomendación absoluta si nunca antes has jugado a un Fallout. Que mejor plan que pasear por el yermo durante horas con albóndiga, realizando misiones bizarras (como nos tienen acostumbrados en la saga) al son de música de la época, todo esto acompañado de una ambientación espectacular y con un gunplay bastante decente.

Este Fallout también nos incluye como novedad la construcciónes y gestión de asentamientos, la verdad es que esta parte es un poco "meh", está implementada de manera irregular por lo que yo la acabé haciendo muy por encima. Por suerte puedes pasarte el juego sin tener que enfocarte mucho en ello. Por último, no puedo dejar de mencionar que el juego sigue siendo un compendio de bugs pero eso ya es marca Bethesda.

Nota: 9
Conclusión: Sigue dando todo lo que esperas de un Fallout, ambientación brutal, música de época y muchas situaciones bizarras. Muy recomendado!!!

185184382.review:
Fallout 4 is one of those games that I’ve sunk hundreds of hours into—and it’s not just because of the action or the gripping storyline, though those are definitely a big part of the fun. What truly makes this game special is the freedom to escape into its world in so many different ways. Sometimes, I find myself stepping away from the chaos and simply losing hours in the quiet moments.

There’s something incredibly soothing about spending a day in a random shack, far from the action, tinkering with a gas tank launcher I found by chance. Or spending countless hours building my own settlements, shaping a world that feels uniquely mine. These moments of solitude and creativity are what really make Fallout 4 stand out to me—they allow you to exist in its world, not just fight through it.

The modding community is another huge factor. The mods breathe new life into the game, adding fresh content and enhancing the experience in ways that keep it feeling new every time I return. It’s one of the reasons why Fallout 4 never really gets old.

My little brother and I share a love for this game, and we’ve spent hours exploring, building, and living in its post-apocalyptic world. Fallout 4 isn’t just a game; it’s an experience that lets you carve your own path and lose yourself in its world, one that’s as alive as you choose to make it.

185162096.review:
Aside from the next gen update completely breaking all old gen saves and adding ultimately nothing worthwhile in said update, the game itself is great, and it has and will remain one of my favorite action RPGs from Bethesda. Sure, it's janky beyond belief. Sure, the weapon designs are terrible. Sure, the game runs on an ancient game engine held together with duct tape. That all doesn't matter. I still had fun with this game, and that's all that matter. Sporting a combined total of 1000+ hours across console AND PC, I will have a special love for this game. 

At the moment, don't go breaking your back trying to mod or buy this game. It's a fun time, but Bethesda is hellbent on changing nothing and breaking everything at the same time. However, giving the game itself a negative review is unfair when it has been out since 2015. It will be a long while before the modding scene will be fixed, but the game still was a blast when at its peak. The community's too split between moving forward with updates and staying in the past versions.

185159688.review:
La review que nadie necesitaba, ni yo pensaba escribir hoy.

Pero recién lo estuve jugando un rato en la Deck. Y hace un par de días, estuve jugándolo en la PC, con el mod de Fallout London. Y un par de días antes, lo estuve jugando en VR, con mods.

Por todo lo malo que puedo decir de este juego, por su engine roto, rotísimo, por el meme que es Bethesda últimamente, por todo lo que han bardeado a la historia principal de este juego (y quizás tengan razón), por las 1000 misiones de los minutemANOTHER SETTLEMENT NEEDS YOUR HELP...

...por todo eso y mucho más, hay algo muy bueno dentro de este juego. Algo muy especial. Quizás sea más especial para mí que para otros. Porque lo bajé de steam verdolaga cuando recién salía... y en ese momento de mi vida estaba perdiendo a alguien. ¿Fue por jugar mucho Fallout 4? aunque podría decir que sí, no, no fue por el juego. Era por mí, que me estaba perdiendo. Estaba entrando en una etapa de mi vida que no iba a poder ver hasta muchos años después. Incluso luego de haber "recuperado" a esa persona. Y habiendo vuelto a perder a ese alguien, una vez más.

Hay algo que siempre me hace volver al Fallout 4. Algo que me hace pasar horas en Sanctuary, mirando cómo sale el sol.

La historia la pasé hace tiempo ya. Cuando salió. Lo mismo para los DLCs. No importa. Siempre me gusta volver a jugarlos.

Sé que esto no es una review en serio, pero yo tampoco soy una persona en serio. No, no soy un synth. Soy un gil que se conecta con los juegos desde otro lado. Y con lo mucho que me cuesta conectar desde hace algunos años con la mayoría de los juegos... está bien que le dedique mi tiempo a uno que me hace bien.

No podría decirte si es un juego para vos o no. Sí puedo decir que lo recomiendo. Recomiendo perderse mucho en él. Pero también recomiendo que no se olviden de la gente importante que tienen alrededor. Si alguien les importa, levanten el culo de la silla, y hagan algo para hacerle saber a esa persona que les importa. Mañana puede ser tarde.

Dejo uno de mis videos boludos de cómo corre en la Deck, por si a alguien le sirve o le interesa. Súper bien. Tener en cuenta que grabar al mismo tiempo que jugás en la Deck, no es lo mismo que en la pc. La performance baja un toque. Y así y todo se ve genial.

https://youtu.be/PVohqIYJtUc

Si no lo tienen, cómprenlo. Tiene mil fallas. Pero también un millón de aciertos. Abrazo.

185129033.review:
Es el segundo mejor Fallout hasta ahora, la verdad es que es un juego muy bueno, con muchas horas de entretenimiento. Si te gusta crear cosas, desde casas, asentamientos, armas, te va a gustar este juego. Las historias de las facciones secundarias son interesantes pero no son muy llamativas, la historia principal es un poco sosa después de enterarte del "plot twist" pero fuera de eso, el gunplay es mucho mejor en esta entrega, los diálogos definitivamente son buenos, la elección no tanta. 

Si lo estas jugando en un equipo suficientemente fuerte, recomiendo encarecidamente jugar un modpack llamado "StoryWealth", en mi opinión es la experiencia definitiva para Fallout 4, cientos de horas se pasan en un abrir y cerrar de ojos.

En conclusión, si te gustan los western RPG, las armas, los elementos fantásticos, nucleares o simplemente acabas de ver la serie de Amazon Prime, disfrutaras Fallout 4, no hay error.

184990078.review: This game has a dog as a follower. I mean, how could you possibly say no to that? It’s like choosing between saving the world or hanging out with the most loyal, furry companion ever. Sure, the apocalypse is in full swing, but your dog will still look at you like you’re the hero. Forget about saving the Commonwealth, I’m just trying to keep my pup from getting into random radiation puddles or chewing up my last can of beans. But honestly, if the end of civilisation means I get to have a dog at my side while fighting off mutant monstrosities... well, I’m in. 10/10, would pet the dog again.

184988885.review:
Ho passato centinaia e centinaia di ore su Fallout 4, giocandolo su più piattaforme, e ogni volta è stato un viaggio straordinario in un mondo post-apocalittico unico e ricco di possibilità.  

La cosa che mi ha conquistato è stata la libertà totale: esplorare la Zona Contaminata, costruire insediamenti, combattere supermutanti e scoprire storie nascoste in ogni angolo del mondo. Bethesda ha creato un universo vivo e pulsante, pieno di dettagli e luoghi da scoprire. Ogni partita mi ha regalato qualcosa di nuovo, grazie alla vastità del gioco e alla libertà di scelta.  

Il sistema di crafting e costruzione degli insediamenti è stato un’aggiunta che mi ha letteralmente assorbito per ore. Personalizzare rifugi, creare difese e vedere le mie città prendere vita è stata una parte del gioco che ho adorato. E le opzioni per personalizzare le armi e l’equipaggiamento? Incredibili.  

Anche la storia principale è affascinante: cercare mio figlio e scegliere tra le fazioni del Commonwealth mi ha fatto riflettere su chi sono e su cosa significa davvero costruire un futuro in un mondo distrutto. Il combattimento, grazie al sistema V.A.T.S., è divertente e strategico, perfetto per affrontare orde di nemici o boss più impegnativi.  

Non posso non menzionare la grafica e l’atmosfera. Nonostante il gioco abbia qualche anno, l’ambientazione post-apocalittica è incredibilmente immersiva, accompagnata da una colonna sonora che alterna brani vintage e musiche ambientali che ti fanno sentire davvero parte del mondo di gioco.  

In breve, Fallout 4 è stato più di un gioco per me: è stato un’avventura infinita, sempre diversa e sempre appassionante. Lo consiglio a chiunque voglia perdersi in un universo ricco di storie e possibilità.

184970230.review:
Game without survival mode on 6/10
Game with survival mode on 9/10

Do yourself a favor and try it. Combat is actually challenging, enemies and the player character are both squishy and die in a few hits. The SPECIAL stats actually matter. Certain perks like Aqua Boy/Girl become much more useful. Not having fast travel forces the player to make meaningful plans when taking trips into town. Vertibird travel becomes a key feature. Cooking, drinking, and sleeping are very important. In my opinion its the definitive way to play FO 4 and I hope whenever FO 5 comes out, its an option on release. My only complaint is the typical Bethesda crashes causing time loss since saves are tied into sleeping. There is a mod for that in case that is a deal breaker for some people.

184966346.review:
Fallout 4 – це неоднозначний досвід для мене, гра, з якою я маю стосунки любові та ненависті.

Ті, хто займався дизайном рівнів, – справжні генії своєї справи. Я жодного разу не побачив двох однакових зон, будинків чи кімнат. Жодна печера не схожа на попередню. Всюди розкидані дрібні предмети побуту, а скелети мовчки розповідають свою історію. Відчувається, що світ не виник із порожнечі, а кожна його деталь органічно вписана у функціонування міста. Заводи, школи, наукові будівлі, видавництва, газети, заправки, поліція – все виглядає логічно і переконливо. Пророблено неймовірну роботу.

Втім, є одне "але". За сюжетом гри минуло 200 років після скидання бомб, а люди досі не відбудували інфраструктуру і живуть у зруйнованих будинках, де все ще лежать скелети. Це дещо псує загальну картину. Тож, хоча дизайн виконаний блискуче, він дисонує із сюжетними реаліями, закладеними сценаристами.

Щодо квестів – це далеко не найкраще, що створювала Bethesda. Відчуваються різкі перепади між "цікавий сюжетний поворот" і банальним "принеси-віддай". Однак невеликі, переважно містичні, квести заслуговують на окрему увагу. Видно, що вони зроблені з очевидною любов'ю до деталей, і той, хто їх створював, дійсно захоплюється своєю роботою.

Оптимізація. Я ненавиджу вас, Bethesda. Як можна продовжувати створювати ігри на такому жахливому рушії – для мене загадка. High-end ПК 2023 року подекуди видає лише 50 FPS просто тому що... ну, тому що. Жодних пояснень не буде, адже навіть сама Bethesda, схоже, не знає, як зробити свої ігри оптимізованими.

184947301.review:
รีวิวเกม Fallout 4: การผจญภัยในโลกหลังหายนะที่ตราตรึงใจ

Fallout 4 เป็นเกมแนวแอ็กชัน RPG แบบโอเพนเวิลด์ที่พัฒนาโดย Bethesda Game Studios ซึ่งเปิดโอกาสให้ผู้เล่นได้สำรวจโลกที่ถูกทำลายจากสงครามนิวเคลียร์ในมุมมองที่หลากหลาย ตั้งแต่การต่อสู้ การเอาตัวรอด ไปจนถึงการสร้างชุมชนใหม่

เนื้อเรื่อง

เรื่องราวเริ่มต้นในปี 2077 ผู้เล่นรับบทเป็นผู้รอดชีวิตที่ตื่นขึ้นมาจาก Vault 111 หลังการแช่แข็งมานานกว่า 200 ปี เพื่อค้นหาลูกชายที่ถูกลักพาตัวไป เนื้อเรื่องเต็มไปด้วยอารมณ์ที่ลึกซึ้งและคำถามที่ชวนคิดเกี่ยวกับมนุษยธรรมและความอยู่รอดในโลกที่ไม่เหมือนเดิม

จุดเด่นของเกม
 1. โลกที่กว้างใหญ่และเต็มไปด้วยรายละเอียด
Fallout 4 พาผู้เล่นสำรวจ Commonwealth ซึ่งเป็นพื้นที่หลังสงครามที่มีความหลากหลาย ตั้งแต่เมืองร้าง โรงงาน ไปจนถึงพื้นที่รกร้างอันตราย ทุกจุดเต็มไปด้วยเรื่องราวให้ค้นหา
 2. การสร้างและปรับแต่ง
ระบบ Crafting เป็นหนึ่งในจุดเด่น ผู้เล่นสามารถสร้างไอเท็ม อาวุธ เกราะ และแม้กระทั่งการสร้างชุมชน (Settlement) ที่ช่วยให้คุณใช้ความคิดสร้างสรรค์ได้อย่างเต็มที่ การสร้างฐานที่พักอาศัยช่วยเพิ่มความสนุกและความรู้สึกเหมือนเป็นส่วนหนึ่งของโลกเกม
 3. กลุ่มฝ่ายและความขัดแย้ง
Fallout 4 มีหลายฝ่ายให้เลือกเข้าร่วม เช่น Minutemen, Institute, Railroad และ Brotherhood of Steel (ซึ่งผมชอบมากที่สุด!) แต่ละฝ่ายมีอุดมการณ์ที่แตกต่างกัน และการตัดสินใจของคุณจะส่งผลต่อชะตากรรมของโลกในเกม
 4. การปรับแต่งตัวละคร
เกมให้คุณออกแบบตัวละครได้ละเอียด ทั้งหน้าตา เพศ และทักษะ ผู้เล่นสามารถพัฒนาความสามารถ (Perks) ให้เหมาะกับสไตล์การเล่น ไม่ว่าจะชอบลอบเร้น ใช้อาวุธหนัก หรือเจรจาต่อรอง
 5. ภารกิจที่หลากหลาย
Fallout 4 มีภารกิจทั้งหลักและรองที่น่าสนใจ การทำเควสต์รองบางครั้งให้ผลตอบแทนที่ดีและสร้างความเข้าใจเพิ่มเติมเกี่ยวกับโลกและตัวละคร

ข้อสังเกต

แม้เกมจะยอดเยี่ยม แต่ก็มีข้อสังเกตเล็กน้อย เช่น
 • กราฟิก แม้จะสวยงามในยุคนั้น แต่บางส่วนอาจดูเก่าเมื่อเทียบกับเกมยุคใหม่
 • ระบบสนทนา ถูกปรับให้ง่ายขึ้น แต่บางคนอาจรู้สึกว่าลดทอนความลึกซึ้งในการตอบโต้

ความรู้สึกส่วนตัว

Fallout 4 เป็นเกมที่ให้ประสบการณ์ที่สนุกและคุ้มค่า โดยเฉพาะอย่างยิ่งถ้าคุณชอบโลกโอเพนเวิลด์และการสำรวจ ความสนุกไม่ได้จำกัดแค่เนื้อเรื่องหลัก แต่ยังอยู่ในการสร้างฐาน สำรวจซากอารยธรรม และการตัดสินใจที่ส่งผลต่อเรื่องราว ผมชอบ Brotherhood of Steel เพราะพวกเขาให้ความสำคัญกับเทคโนโลยีและความเป็นระเบียบ แต่บางครั้งก็ทำให้ผมต้องตั้งคำถามเกี่ยวกับความถูกต้องในอุดมการณ์ของพวกเขา

คะแนน

9/10 Fallout 4 คือการผจญภัยที่เต็มไปด้วยอิสระและความคิดสร้างสรรค์ เหมาะสำหรับผู้ที่มองหาเกมที่มีความลึกและการตัดสินใจที่ส่งผลต่อโลกเกม

สรุป: ถ้าคุณยังไม่เคยเล่น Fallout 4 มันคือเกมที่คุณไม่ควรพลาด!

184938380.review:
I'm new to this game and am really enjoying it, but the main reason I'm enjoying it is that I've modded it and adjusted some key settings that aren't easily changed. This game is old and not easy to tweak, but with the right adjustments can be very playable and similar to more modern games. 

I used the "Quality of Life" mod collection found on Nexus mods, as well as a few other mods. This collection has instructions and uses the Vortex mod manager, which is not very user friendly. I've modded other games and you always need to go slow, be careful, and follow the directions, but it never took me TEN HOURS to do it, as it did with this game. It was stressfull and the process I followed is prone to errors. I had to be really careful and search for solutions and confirmation to some steps along the way. Is the mod load order actually correct, and can I figure out how to change it with this mod manager? Did I remember to disable one of the plug-ins after using it? Did I move the files installed in the wrong folder and edit the .ini files properly to make this mod collection work? Ugh. 

The other mods I have added and enjoyed very much include weightless junk, better companions, and a few more. They're easy to find, but make sure each mod is for the right game version and is compatible with the other ones. 

The mouse sensitivity, fov, and other settings can't be easily changed. Here are some instructions: 

https://youtu.be/vr0ThV4dYdA?si=g_kXOg6rBIuwi3VJ

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=551069501&tscn=1447077828

Note that if you've used the mod pack and Vortex mod manager (or any other mods manager) you may need to also edit other .ini files to match these changes. 

In the end I have a great looking game, my fov is 90 for 1st and 3rd person, mouse sensitivity is corrected with no lag, I get 60fps easily (to match my 4k tv that I'm using as a monitor), and the QOL mods make this game way more playable. Without all of that work I wouldn't be playing this game. After doing all of that work I'm loving this game.

184914963.review:
Started the game watching my wife get a bullet to the head. Thanks for that, Bethesda, really setting the tone there. Then my son gets kidnapped, I get cryo-frozen like a pre-war TV dinner and I wake up in a future where everything’s terrible and also radioactive.

Spent a good chunk of time looting corpses and cramming my pockets full of random junk like a kleptomaniac raccoon, because hey, you never know when you’ll need 37 coffee cups and a fancy hairbrush. Somewhere along the way, I met Preston 'Gravy' (yes, I misread his name and no, I will not be taking questions), but surprisingly, he didn’t ask me to save any settlements. Guess I dodged a bullet there.

Eventually, I derailed the main quest to go explore Nuka World like an idiot, because who cares about my missing son when I can ride roller coasters and fight raiders in a theme park? When I finally found Shaun, turns out he’s old enough to rent a car and is running the Institute like some kind of dystopian Elon Musk. Cue some light war crimes as I join factions, betray factions and blow stuff up for reasons I can’t fully remember.

In the end, my son dies (great, thanks again, Bethesda) and I inherit a shadow government that no one really likes. So now I’m sad, irradiated and technically the boss of a synth-making empire. So again, dystopian Elon Musk.

10/10 would loot more coffee cups and listen to Diamond City Radio again while completely ignoring the actual plot!

Fallout 4 é incrível: muito imersivo, com ótima história principal, e várias outras paralelas tão boas quanto; gameplay muito bem polido e preciso; personagens carismáticos e interessantes; além de ser o mais bonito da franquia. Além disso, acertaram em cheio nos recursos de construção de assentamentos; gastei muitas horas fazendo e desfazendo casas cada vez mais elaboradas e as enfeitando. É muito interessante perceber as coisas realmente funcionando, e os NPCs interagindo com aquilo que você construiu.
Alguns pontos negativos: trilha sonora fraca, se comparada a seus antecessores; platina extremamente sofrível graças aos conteúdos das DLCs, em especial às missões do Nuka-World, que não fazem jus a tudo que construímos durante todo o jogo base, e além de muito repetitivas são muito chatas; sem falar nos coletáveis, que são MUITOS se somarmos todas as DLCs e o jogo base, o que torna isso uma tarefa dolorosa; mas nada se compara à conquista dos 100k bilhetes Nuka-Cade, que é simplesmente uma tarefa injusta.
Porém, a maioria dos defeitos desaparecem para quem não vai atrás do 100%, sendo assim um jogo muito recomendado para amantes de RPG ocidental, e principalmente da franquia Fallout.
